alert.note: Alert for Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 9:17PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hidalgo and western Willacy Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 917 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Faysville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Manuel, Hargill, Linn, Faysville, Edinburg North High School, Monte Cristo Elementary School, Red Gate, Doolittle, Edinburg South Texas International Airport Edinburg South Texas International Airport and Hargill Elementary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
